target.dc:title: Clinical NLP classifier (supervised learning)
target.dcterms:license: Internal use license (hospital network only); redistribution prohibited

party.foaf:name: Clinicians and triage nurses in outpatient settings

odrl:and.rightOperand: Healthcare (clinical decision support; symptom triage)
Assisting triage prioritization, routing patients to departments, summarizing common complaint categories for intake workflow
Clinicians and triage nurses in outpatient settings
Automated suggestions on the presence of pneumonia in adult chest X-ray images in clinical triage environments
Aggregated trend analysis of complaint categories (non-identifying), operational dashboards, workload planning
Healthcare operations & reporting
Trained on 4× NVIDIA A100 (80GB); deployed on CPU for batch scoring and 1× NVIDIA T4 for realtime API
Python 3.11, PyTorch 2.x, HuggingFace Transformers, FastAPI, Docker
Held-out hospital triage notes (2024-Q4), synthetic misspelling set, external public symptom QA set (for robustness only)
Free-text length (5–300 tokens), spelling noise, multilingual inputs (EN/DA/DE), rare symptom categories, age-group phrasing differences
Macro-F1: 0.86 on in-domain test set; AUROC: 0.93 avg; p95 latency: 120ms (GPU) / 680ms (CPU)
Macro-F1
Precision/Recall per class
AUROC (one-vs-rest)
Calibration (ECE)
Latency (p95)
Fine-tuning with AdamW; cross-entropy loss; class-weighting for imbalance
~1.2M de-identified triage notes + complaint labels mapped to 28 symptom categories
Data cleaning + PHI redaction validation, stratified split by facility, early stopping on dev Macro-F1, threshold tuning for top-3 output
Rebalanced sampling, per-group performance monitoring, multilingual augmentation, human review for low-confidence predictions
Lower accuracy for rare categories and mixed-symptom narratives; sensitive to short/ambiguous inputs; performance may degrade for languages beyond EN/DA/DE
Using outputs as definitive diagnosis, denying care based on predicted category, exporting inputs to third-party tools
Potential leakage of sensitive content if raw inputs are logged or exported; re-identification risk from free-text
No storage of raw patient text by default; optional logging requires approval, minimization, and retention limits (e.g., 30 days)
GDPR-aligned processing controls; clinical risk management aligned with internal medical device guidance
Intended as decision-support only; not certified as a standalone medical device; requires local validation before clinical rollout
Over-reliance by staff, incorrect routing for rare symptoms, reduced performance on out-of-distribution text
Mandatory training for users, usage constraints in UI, escalation to clinician review when confidence is low or symptoms are severe
Medium (clinical workflow impact), potentially High if used beyond triage support
Incident reporting workflow, quarterly model monitoring, rollback plan, red-team testing for prompt injection and data exfiltration attempts
Human-in-the-loop requirement; confidence thresholds; “uncertain” output option; prominent disclaimer: not a diagnosis tool
TLS in transit, encryption at rest, access control (RBAC), audit logs, rate limiting, secured deployment network
Class imbalance (rare conditions), language bias (best performance in Danish/English), demographic phrasing differences (age-related descriptions)
Patients/self-diagnosis use; non-clinical staff making clinical decisions
Use only for triage assistance with clinician oversight
Review top-3 suggestions (not only top-1)
Monitor drift monthly and revalidate after workflow or data changes
